summary: This document is an email chain from October 2019 regarding the FBI Victim Services Division's upcoming briefings for victims of Jeffrey Epstein. It involves a law firm (Podhurst Orseck) coordinating the notification of additional victims and forwarding an FBI invitation.

persons.name: Robert C. Josefsberg
persons.context: Attorney at Podhurst Orseck, P.A. who is being sent a list of additional Epstein victims to notify about FBI briefings. His assistant is handling the communication.

persons.name: Mary E. Valledor
persons.context: Assistant to Robert C. Josefsberg and Ramon A. Rasco at Podhurst Orseck. She is sending and forwarding emails containing the list of additional Epstein victims for notification.

persons.name: Ramon A. Rasco
persons.context: Attorney at Podhurst Orseck, P.A., mentioned as someone Mary Valledor also assists.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the case; the briefings are for victims of his crimes.

connections.description: Valledor is the assistant to attorney Josefsberg, handling correspondence and victim list coordination for him.
Valledor is also the assistant to attorney Rasco.
Josefsberg's firm is involved in representing or notifying victims of Epstein, indicating a legal connection to the case.

events.title: FBI Victim Briefing in Miami
events.description: The FBI Victim Services Division is hosting a briefing for victims of Jeffrey Epstein at the Miami Field Office.

events.title: FBI Victim Briefing in New York
events.description: The FBI Victim Services Division is hosting a briefing for victims of Jeffrey Epstein at the New York Field Office.

locations: New York, NY (New York Field Office)
SunTrust International Center, One SE Third Avenue, Suite 2300, Miami, FL 33131 (Podhurst Orseck office)
keyFacts: The FBI Victim Services Division was organizing briefings for Epstein victims in October 2019, indicating ongoing victim outreach and investigation after Epstein's death.
The law firm Podhurst Orseck was involved in coordinating notification of additional Epstein victims for these FBI briefings.
The communication reveals that the FBI was proactively contacting law firms representing identified victims to ensure their clients were informed about support briefings.
The document highlights a structured process for victim notification through legal representatives, suggesting a significant number of victims were represented by counsel.
